words.definition: Anthropology is the study of people, society, and culture.
words.example: In anthropology class, I learned about simple tools used by ancient cultures.

words.definition: To applaud means to clap in order to show approval.
words.example: Everyone cheered and applauded Manny’s efforts.

words.definition: To appoint someone to a job means to give the job to them.
words.example: Two students were appointed to help the scientists with their research.

words.definition: When things are compatible, they work well or exist together successfully.
words.example: Jan and Fred are too different. They will never be compatible.

words.definition: Competence is the ability to do something well or effectively.
words.example: The job requires a high level of competence in English.

words.definition: To confer with someone means to discuss something with them to make a decision.
words.example: I will confer with my advisors before I choose a university.

words.definition: When things are consecutive, they happen one after another without interruption.
words.example: It rained for three consecutive days.

words.definition: When something is crude, it is not exact or skilled; it can also mean natural.
words.example: The boy made a crude house out of cardboard boxes.

words.definition: A cube is a solid object with six equal square sides.
words.example: Please put a cube of ice in my glass of water.

words.definition: Feedback is comments or information about how well someone is doing something.
words.example: I got some positive feedback from my teacher on my science project.

words.definition: Ignorance is lack of knowledge about something.
words.example: His ignorance about the law caused him many problems.

words.definition: When something is masculine, it is typical of or suitable for men.
words.example: He has a very masculine voice.

words.definition: A monument is a structure built to remind people of an important event or person.
words.example: A large monument was built in the park to honor the war heroes.

words.definition: When someone is muscular, they are very strong and have big muscles.
words.example: He is very muscular because he exercises every day.

words.definition: Your posture is the way in which you stand or sit.
words.example: Good posture is important for a healthy back.

words.definition: To situate something means to put it in a particular place.
words.example: The house is situated on a hill overlooking the sea.

words.definition: To supervise means to be in charge of something and make sure it is done correctly.
words.example: My job is to supervise the construction of the new building.

words.definition: Symmetry is the quality of having two parts that are the same on both sides.
words.example: The wings of a butterfly have perfect symmetry.

words.definition: A tattoo is a design drawn on someone’s skin with needles and ink.
words.example: The man has a large tattoo of a dragon on his arm.

words.definition: An undergraduate is a student at a university who is studying for their first degree.
words.example: She is an undergraduate student at Harvard University.
